title: BRYKHON
content:
BRYKHON (Brychon) was a river-god of Khalkidike (Chalcidice) in Thrake, north of Greece.

The Brykhon stream flowed into the Aegean between the peninsulars of Sithonia and Pallene in Thrakian
        Khalkidike. The two major neighbouring rivers were the Strymon to the east and
        Axios in the west.

Lycophron, Alexandra 1405 ff (trans. Mair) (Greek poet C3rd B.C.) :
        "The plains of the Sithonians and the fields of Pallene, where the ox-horned [river] Brykhon (Brychon), who
        served the Gigantes (Giants), fattens with his waters." [N.B. The Gigantes of Khalkidike waged war on the
        gods.]
